# The Big (Beyesian) Picture {#sec-chap-001} ::::: {#obj-chap-001} :::: {.my-objectives} ::: {.my-objectives-header} Objectives ::: ::: {.my-objectives-container} - Learn to think like a Bayesian. - Explore the foundations of a Bayesian data analysis and how they contrast with the frequentist alternative. - Learn a little bit about the history of the Bayesian philosophy. ::: :::: ::::: ## Think like an Bayesian :::::{.my-r-code} :::{.my-r-code-header} :::::: {#cnj-001-thinking-bayesian-1} : Bayesian thinking: Example Italian Restaurant :::::: ::: ::::{.my-r-code-container} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} DiagrammeR::grViz(" digraph thinking_bayesian{ # node statement node [shape = oval] a [label = 'Incoming (prior) Information\nFive start restaurant']; b [label = 'Data:\nsoggy noodles']; c [label = 'Updates (posterior) information\nThree star restaurant']; d [label = 'Another visit (new data):\ntasty alfredo']; e [label = 'Updated (posterior) information\nFour star reastaurant']; f [label = 'Another visit: (new data):\nso-so salad'] g [style = invisible ] # edge statement a -> c b -> c c -> e d -> e f-> g [style = dashed] e-> g [style = dashed] }") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: :::: ::::: Summarizing and generalizing the above graphic we get the following graph: :::::{.my-r-code} :::{.my-r-code-header} :::::: {#cnj-001-bayesian-thinking-2} : Bayesian thinking: The general process :::::: ::: ::::{.my-r-code-container} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} DiagrammeR::grViz(" digraph thinking_bayesian{ # node statement node [shape = oval] a [label = 'Prior']; b [label = 'Data']; c [label = 'Posterior']; d [label = 'New data']; e [label = 'Posterior']; f [label = 'New data'] g [style = invisible ] # edge statement a -> c b -> c c -> e d -> e f-> g [style = dashed] e-> g [style = dashed] }") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
